subs.text: September 8

The second part of the UK TV series House of Cards imagines a strained relationship between the prime minister and an activist King (a very thinly veiled version of then-Prince Charles) after the Queen dies. [link]
subs.rawText: The second part of the UK TV series House of Cards imagines a strained relationship between the prime minister and an activist King (a very thinly veiled version of then-Prince Charles) after the Queen dies. https://t.co/lwZjEcB1D1

subs.text: You might very well think that House of Cards (UK) is better than the American version of the show, but I couldn‚Äôt possibly comment.
subs.rawText: You might very well think that House of Cards (UK) is better than the American version of the show, but I couldn‚Äôt possibly comment.

subs.text: I went to bed last night angry and sad about how unfair it was that I didn‚Äôt get to see my mother for over a year and a half before she died, but glad at all the time I had to talk with her up until the end.
subs.rawText: I went to bed last night angry and sad about how unfair it was that I didn‚Äôt get to see my mother for over a year and a half before she died, but glad at all the time I had to talk with her up until the end.

subs.text: Anyway, if you need me to be angry and sad about something, it‚Äôll have to compete with that.
subs.rawText: Anyway, if you need me to be angry and sad about something, it‚Äôll have to compete with that.

subs.text: September 5

My handsome heroism last night at the Wu-Tang Clan concert was to zip up the backpack of a quite intoxicated woman. (I wonder how long she went with it open. It takes Torontonians a really long time to point something like that out.) I got a friendly pat on the shoulder for that.
subs.rawText: My handsome heroism last night at the Wu-Tang Clan concert was to zip up the backpack of a quite intoxicated woman. (I wonder how long she went with it open. It takes Torontonians a really long time to point something like that out.) I got a friendly pat on the shoulder for that.
